question: Question_A_10
hints:
Before you start, what is the dimension of the resulting matrix
\emph{AB}?

Remember matrix multiplication. To get the element in the first row and
first column of \emph{AB}, take the first row of \emph{A} form the dot
product with the first column of \emph{B}.

To get the element of the second row and first column of \emph{AB}, take
the second row of \emph{A} and form the dot product with the first
column of \emph{B}.

Continue with this scheme to fill all spots in \emph{AB} accordingly.
